mil7.3.9:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil7.3.9:0.2_0: The account of the fault-finding mind
mil7.3.9:1.1_0: “Are you able to take one part in the forest?”
mil7.3.9:1.2_0: “Great king, as this worker I don’t work for the sake of my bondservants, workers, and staff, I’m incapable of negligence.
mil7.3.9:1.3_0: In the same way, a layman who stays like this should believing in the crossroads of the four primary elements, ‘I will be diligent, keen, and resolute.’
mil7.3.9:1.4_0: This is the one factor of worker.
mil7.3.9:1.5_0: When you’ve spoken like this, great king, you won’t honor the senior monks,
mil7.3.9:2.2_0: to being reborn time and again.
mil7.3.9:3.1_0: The ninth with understanding of a worker.
